title: Multi-screen interaction
abstract: Philips has three business areas, one of them is consumer lifestyle department and within this department, there are eight business groups and this project belongs to Business Group Television. Multi-Screen Interaction is one of Business Group Television project. Multi-Screen Interaction is an idea that makes Philips TV as a server which will perform drawing commands from a client. Multi-Screen Interaction means there will be more one screen interacts with each others. The assignment for graduation project is to create a service to be built in the television that can handle drawing commands and can perform drawing task in the television and also to investigate the reliable way to develop this idea. This assignment will be used Android operating system which acts as the client. The development of the assignment is based on an investigation, designing, prototyping and testing. By using this methodology, there is no specific phase, but this methodology is iterative incremental framework.
contributors: MEKENKAMP (Advisor 1); VAN VEUGEN (Advisor 2); CASPER SCHELLEKENS (Examination Committee 1)
source: Undergraduate Thesis No. 01021173/INF/2012; Robert Yuwono Abadi (26408037)
subjects: DISPLAY BOARDS-COMPUTER PROGRAMS; DISPLAY BOARDS-ELECTRONICS; DISPLAY BOARDS
